page.title: 15ROSE CASTLE: BISHOP'S HOME
page.content: Rose Castle has been the home of the Carlisle Bishops since the thirteenth century. It is built from a sandstone which is a "rose" colour, which is probably why it is called "Rose Castle", so the Bishop presumes; or he says that it maybe because it is so elegant like a rose. Not all of the rooms are lived in all the year round. The only time all the bedrooms are used is when there is an ordination, because all the prospective curates stay (with their wives, if they are married) at the Rose. Rose Castle is open to the public (with prior arrangement with the Bishop) because it is of great beauty and is of great historical value.
